definition: to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Some officers lashed out with batons and shields, but their superiors restrained them.
sentences.chinese: 一些警察揮動着警棍和盾牌，但被他們的上級阻止了。

sentences.english: The whip swished through the air.
sentences.chinese: 鞭子嗖地一聲在空中揮動。

sentences.english: The young man swung his mallet for another blow.
sentences.chinese: 這個年輕人揮動球棍準備擊球。

sentences.english: Athletes often swing their arms and warm up before a game.
sentences.chinese: 運動員常常在比賽之前揮動手臂進行熱身運動。

sentences.english: Goldworm continued to struggle and wave his arms, but with ever-diminishing style.
sentences.chinese: 戈德沃姆繼續掙扎，並揮動着胳膊，但越來越無力。

sentences.english: Don't wring your hands like a substitute teacher in the wildest home room.
sentences.chinese: 不要像在年級教室裏的代課老帥一樣使勁揮動雙手。

sentences.english: The man saw us and stopped his assault. They both waved me on.
sentences.chinese: 那個男人停止了攻擊看這我們，並朝我們揮動着拳頭。

sentences.english: She fluttered her handkerchief from the train window as a goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 她在火車的窗口揮動着手絹道別。

sentences.english: The man was waving a flag at the railway crossing.
sentences.chinese: 那人在鐵路交叉處揮動一面信號旗。

sentences.english: Frustrated, he swings his arms about, scattering the strips of cloth.
sentences.chinese: 失望的他揮動手臂，弄亂地上的布條。

sentences.english: Forty-five minutes later, a window rolled down and a hand waved us back.
sentences.chinese: 四十五分鐘後，車窗搖了下來，一隻手向我們揮動。

sentences.english: In robberies brandishing the weapon will usually do.
sentences.chinese: 在搶劫的時候，只要揮動一下你的武器通常就足夠了。

sentences.english: I looked out the window. Mable was swishing her broom down the street.
sentences.chinese: 我向窗外望去，只見梅布爾正揮動掃帚沿街掃地。

sentences.english: Now swing your bat like I do.
sentences.chinese: 來，照我的樣子揮動球棒。

sentences.english: Warren had been talking along very solemnly, flourishing his pointer.
sentences.chinese: 華倫一直很嚴肅地講着，揮動着手裏的教鞭。

definition: to hold firmly, not let go
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
